title: Los Balcones & Los Altos: Affordable Golf Area Living
excerpt: Los Balcones and Los Altos property guide near Villamartin golf courses. Affordable properties from €150k, golf lifestyle, close to La Zenia Boulevard shopping and 30 min from airport.
author: New Build Homes Costa Blanca

content.quickAnswer: Los Balcones and Los Altos offer affordable properties from €150,000 near world-renowned Villamartin golf courses. Perfect for golf enthusiasts seeking Mediterranean lifestyle, close to La Zenia Boulevard shopping and airport access.
content.intro: Los Balcones and Los Altos form adjacent residential communities nestled within Costa Blanca South's premier golf destination zone, surrounding the legendary Villamartin Golf Club. These complementary towns create comprehensive golf lifestyle offering with exceptional value properties, active sporting communities, and convenient access to shopping and coastal amenities. Ideal for golf enthusiasts, families seeking recreational communities, and investors prioritizing lifestyle alongside property value.

sections.title: Los Balcones & Los Altos: Golf Hub Positioning
sections.content: Los Balcones and Los Altos sit inland approximately 12-15 kilometers from the coast, positioned directly adjacent to Villamartin Golf Club—Costa Blanca's most prestigious and internationally recognized golf destination. Los Balcones occupies the northern position with Los Altos to the south, creating contiguous residential zones within the broader Orihuela Costa municipality. The towns sit approximately 18 kilometers west of Torrevieja town center and 48 kilometers from Alicante-Elche Airport. The N-332 coastal highway provides east-west connectivity, while the AP-7 autopista (toll highway) offers rapid access to Alicante and southern destinations. The positioning creates unique geographic advantages—close enough to beaches and shopping for coastal lifestyle access while maintaining golf community focus. Los Balcones and Los Altos remain noticeably quieter and less commercialized than coastal beach towns, creating peaceful residential atmosphere without sacrificing essential services. The residential zones developed originally to house golf course workers and enthusiasts, creating organic community bonds centered on sporting shared interests. Modern development has transformed these functional origins into comprehensive residential destinations with diverse demographics including families, retirees, and golf-focused populations. Villamartin Golf Club's direct adjacency remains the defining characteristic, with properties often marketed explicitly as 'golf view' or 'golf-course frontline' based on positioning relative to fairways and greens.

sections.title: Property Market: Affordability & Golf Positioning
sections.content: Los Balcones and Los Altos offer among Costa Blanca South's most affordable property prices, reflecting inland positioning rather than coastal premium positioning. New build apartments begin at €150,000 for 1-bedroom units, with 2-bedroom properties typically ranging €200,000-€280,000. Townhouses with private gardens range €200,000-€320,000, while detached villas begin around €250,000 and extend to €450,000 for premium golf-view properties. Golf-view and golf-frontline positioning commands 10-30% premiums compared to standard properties at equivalent distances. Established resale properties offer 10-20% discounts compared to new builds, with renovation opportunities in older properties. The rental market remains active though more specialized than coastal towns. Golf-themed vacation rental market generates strong seasonal demand from golfer visitors, with properties commanding €800-€1,200 monthly during peak golf season (November-April) and €400-€600 off-season. Annual yields average 4-5% for dedicated golf vacation rental properties, slightly below coastal equivalents but with different seasonal pattern. Long-term residential rentals generate €500-€750 monthly, providing stable income with lower volatility. The golf community creates ready rental market—golf tourists regularly book properties through golf club referral networks and direct owner arrangements. Property appreciation has averaged 2-3% annually historically, with forecasts suggesting 2.5-3.5% ongoing appreciation. The affordable entry pricing and golf lifestyle appeal create portfolio diversification opportunity for international investors. The combined investment of multiple golf-property acquisitions enables larger portfolio development. Currency diversification benefits international owners as euro appreciation increases property values and rental income.

sections.title: Villamartin Golf Club: Facilities & Membership
sections.content: Villamartin Golf Club stands as Costa Blanca South's most renowned golf destination, featuring three championship 18-hole courses totaling 54 holes. The Old Course (original 1974 layout) designed by Robert Trent Jones showcases dramatic elevation changes, strategic bunker positioning, and challenging Mediterranean terrain. The New Course (1989) offers slightly more forgiving design maintaining championship standards. The Stadium Course (1995) represents the most modern layout with contemporary amenities and premium conditioning. Combined, the 54-hole complex accommodates approximately 100,000+ rounds annually, making it one of Europe's busier golf destinations. Membership options range from full membership (€3,000-€5,000 initiation with €1,200-€2,000 annual fees) to limited memberships and daily green fees (€45-€85 depending on season). The clubhouse features excellent dining facilities, professional service standards, and comprehensive equipment rental. Practice facilities include driving ranges, chipping greens, and putting surfaces suitable for all skill levels. Golf instruction from PGA professionals enables lesson booking at competitive rates (€40-€75 per hour). The golf community emphasizes social elements alongside competition—regular tournaments, social competitions, and group outings maintain active annual calendars. Member demographics span serious competitors to casual recreational players, creating inclusive community despite championship standards. The legendary status and established infrastructure make Villamartin attractive for those integrating golf into Mediterranean lifestyle rather than treating golf as secondary activity.

sections.title: Lifestyle Amenities & Community Services
sections.content: Los Balcones and Los Altos provide comprehensive residential services despite inland positioning rather than coastal beach focus. Local supermarkets including Carrefour Express and Lidl serve daily shopping needs, while La Zenia Boulevard (8 kilometers north) provides comprehensive shopping for specialized items and brands. The drive to La Zenia requires approximately 12-15 minutes, making it accessible for weekend shopping expeditions. Restaurants and bars cluster around golf club areas and town centers, featuring everything from casual Spanish tapas establishments to international cuisine serving the diverse expatriate population. Many restaurants actively target golf community clientele, offering post-game social dining and tournament celebrations. Healthcare access remains good through public and private systems—local clinics provide basic services while Torrevieja Hospital (20 km, 25 minutes) offers comprehensive facilities. Private healthcare through Quirónsalud provides specialist consultations, diagnostic imaging, and elective procedures. Banks, postal services, and administrative facilities operate locally, providing essential bureaucratic access. Schools including international options serve families with children. The peaceful community atmosphere creates family-friendly environment attractive to those with younger generations. Community pools and recreational facilities provide additional amenities beyond golf. The combined golf infrastructure, supporting services, and family-friendly atmosphere create comprehensive residential environment extending well beyond golf-focused amenities. Non-golf family members find complete lifestyle satisfaction through community facilities and social infrastructure.

sections.title: Accessibility & Transportation Networks
sections.content: Los Balcones and Los Altos occupy strategic positioning providing connectivity to both coastal and inland destinations. Alicante-Elche Airport sits approximately 48 kilometers north, requiring 50-55 minutes driving via the N-332 or AP-7 autopista (toll €5-€8 each direction). The inland positioning creates slightly longer airport journeys compared to coastal towns but remains within acceptable commute timeframes. Car rental from Alicante provides flexibility, with agencies offering rates from €25-€50 daily. The N-332 provides east-west connectivity, connecting to Torrevieja (18 km north), coastal beaches (12-15 km east), and inland destinations toward Murcia. The AP-7 autopista provides rapid access toward Alicante and southern regions, though tolls apply for motorway usage (typically €4-€8 per trip). Within Los Balcones and Los Altos, vehicle transportation remains essential—properties scatter across developments requiring car access for practical living. The golf club drives create logical neighborhood organization, but commercial services cluster at distances requiring short car journeys. Parking remains abundant and inexpensive throughout both communities, with dedicated development parking typically complimentary. Public transportation through regional bus services provides connectivity to surrounding towns, though schedules remain less frequent than coastal locations. The inland positioning creates vehicle dependency while avoiding coastal traffic congestion during peak seasons. This geographic advantage appeals to those willing to sacrifice beach proximity for quieter, less congested residential environments. Retirees particularly appreciate the peaceful character combined with medical facility proximity.

sections.title: New Build Quality & Property Development
sections.content: Los Balcones and Los Altos feature modern residential developments meeting contemporary European construction standards. New build properties typically showcase modern amenities including air conditioning, underfloor heating, fitted kitchens, and parking provisions. Community facilities often include shared pools, landscaped gardens, and recreational areas. Construction quality adheres to Spanish building regulations (Código Técnico de la Edificación) with mandatory 10-year structural warranties. Established builders with 10+ year track records ensure quality standards and defect minimization. Property finishes range from basic contemporary (€2,200-€2,600 per square meter) to premium contemporary (€3,000-€3,600 per square meter) depending on materials and finishes. Off-plan purchasing enables acquisition during construction phases with stage payments (typically 20% deposit, 10% quarterly) reducing upfront capital requirements. Properties include certificates of habitability (Cédula de Habitabilidad) and first occupation licenses required for registration and mortgage completion. Transaction costs typically total 8-12% of purchase price including 6% IVA, notary fees €1,500-€2,500, and registration costs approximately 1% of purchase value. Older established properties offer renovation opportunities with potential for value enhancement through modernization. The well-maintained nature of both communities ensures property longevity and appreciation potential. Professional property management services handle rentals, maintenance coordination, and guest services for 20-25% of gross rental income.

sections.title: Expat Community & Social Infrastructure
sections.content: Los Balcones and Los Altos host established expatriate communities representing 50-60% of permanent residents. British nationals comprise the largest demographic (approximately 40%), followed by Scandinavians (20%), Dutch (10%), Germans (8%), and smaller communities from France and Eastern Europe. The golf community creates distinctive social structure with sporting enthusiasts from diverse nationalities bonding through golf shared interests. Golf club social events provide natural community gathering points, with tournament celebrations, social competitions, and member dinners creating regular interaction opportunities. English-language services operate throughout both communities—real estate agents, some restaurants, and select professionals accommodate English speakers. However, greater Spanish cultural presence exists compared to coastal beach towns, particularly within Spanish-oriented establishments. Expatriate social clubs organize non-golf activities including walking groups, hobby clubs, and casual social gatherings. The smaller scale creates closer-knit community compared to larger coastal towns, with easier relationship building and social integration. Coffee mornings and informal social gatherings happen regularly within golf communities. Community bulletin boards and social media groups facilitate information sharing and social coordination. Cost of living remains moderate—couples typically budget €1,200-€1,700 monthly for comfortable lifestyle including housing, utilities, food, and entertainment. The peaceful community character appeals particularly to retirees seeking relaxed Mediterranean living. Younger residents and families enjoy family-friendly atmosphere combined with sophisticated golf lifestyle integration. The combination of established expatriate infrastructure, golf-oriented social structure, and peaceful community atmosphere creates distinctive appeal within Costa Blanca South's broader property markets.

sections.title: Investment Potential & Long-term Appreciation
sections.content: Los Balcones and Los Altos represent solid investment opportunity within Costa Blanca South's inland property market. The affordable entry prices combined with golf lifestyle appeal create diversification from coastal property portfolios. Annual property appreciation has averaged 2-3%, with forecasts suggesting 2.5-3% ongoing appreciation as golf tourism strengthens. Rental yields average 4-5% annually, providing attractive returns on conservative property valuations. The golf tourism market creates reliable rental demand with less seasonality volatility compared to general beach tourism—golf season (November-April) drives peak demand complementing beach season patterns. Properties acquired at €150,000-€200,000 with 4% annual yields generate €6,000-€8,000 yearly income, providing reasonable investment returns. Long-term capital appreciation combined with consistent rental income creates attractive total return profile. The affordable entry pricing enables acquisition of multiple properties building diversified portfolio within moderate total investment. Professional property management provides hands-off investment feasibility for international owners not resident locally. Currency diversification benefits international investors as euro appreciation increases property values and rental income. Spanish tax implications include 19% corporate income tax on non-resident rental profits with expense deductions. Resident property owners benefit from lower personal income tax brackets. Annual property taxes (IBI) typically range €800-€1,400 depending on property value. The combination of affordable pricing, consistent golf tourism, established community, and reliable appreciation trajectory position Los Balcones and Los Altos as portfolio core holding opportunity for conservative investors emphasizing stable returns over spectacular capital appreciation.

content.conclusion: Los Balcones and Los Altos offer exceptional value for those integrating golf lifestyle with Mediterranean property investment. With properties from €150,000, world-class golf facilities, and convenient proximity to shopping and coastal amenities, these communities deliver comprehensive Mediterranean living. The established expatriate infrastructure, peaceful residential character, and proven investment credentials make these communities ideal for families, retirees, and investors prioritizing lifestyle satisfaction alongside property appreciation.
